result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lexi Natasha Mattson

records.addlTxt:
9:21 AM Defendant Lexi Natasha Mattson in court.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Def qualifies for PD.  PD office still looking for attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Def asking for demand/discovery.  Court says not at that point yet.  Def says ID was taken when arrested, section 968.20, court directs to that provision.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lexi Natasha Mattson
Current: 55255 Indian Lake Road, Mason, WI 54856 United States  (Effective: 09-26-2022)
Prior: 1313 Main St W, Ashland, WI 54806

$3000 ALREADY POSTED.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. Except for purposes of employment.
Def to have NO Contact w/ E.P. and D. P-B.
